Created an attachment (id=75327)
Removed test that can cause NPE

workingSet.getID() can return null and cause an exception
Remove test works.

Testing getID() for null causes the display to not be updated.

I don't think it is a good idea to remove this check, because it supposed to collect only working sets of type TaskWorkingSetUpdater.ID_TASK_WORKING_SET. You should check if id is null, or better just reverse the equals() call.

I did check for id == null first, but then the list would not get refreshed (I don't know why though),.
Without the check it does.
Hmmm, I'm off on holiday first, and look into it again when back.

Maarten: I modified your patch to use a null check instead.  Crediting to you since you did the investigation.

			if (workingSet != null && workingSet.getId() != null && workingSet.getId().equalsIgnoreCase(TaskWorkingSetUpdater.ID_TASK_WORKING_SET)) {
